intro: Cyphostemma mannii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, fleshy, berry-like fruits. It is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils along riverbanks and in forest margins. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
